intro: Brachystelma molaventi, commonly known as the Molaventie stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted for storing water in arid environments. Brachystelma molaventi produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring.
